intro: Tribulopis curvicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually bipinnate, and the plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Tribulopis curvicarpa is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
